intro: Actinostemon communis, commonly known as the common actinostemon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white to pale pink, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. Actinostemon communis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats.
